ratings.comment: Professor Dharwadker is amazing. He's so caring, compassionate, and kind. He gives great feedback. Genuinely wants his students to succeed. Very knowledgeable. Great guy, great class. Put in effort (do your best) and you'll be fine.

Class was Eng 443 (the modern short story). Prof is so sweet, caring, passionate, knowledgeable, wants to help students. Lectures are woven with cool facts/tidbits about random topics. Easy grader, isn't trying to make your life difficult, just go to lecture and give him the time of day and you'll be fine. Highly recommend any class with him.
Super passionate about the short stories we read. Very knowledgable about current events and the authors. Long lectures and lots of listening but enjoyable class.
Nice but rambles and takes close reading to an extreme. Spends minutes on 3 lines and spends 45 min+ of each class catching up from the last class. Unclear paper instruction. Narrowminded

He is a great guy and cares about his students. HOWEVER, I did not learn a single thing about English and lectures were extremely boring and unrelated to the readings. Was unable to contact him outside of class despite many emails, and he does not have open office hours. Easy A, but don't expect to learn anything.

Vinay is a great guy and the class is pretty easy and interesting. Not too much reading at all and the stories are memorable. Class is graded on three easy quizzes and a midterm and final paper. Other than that, just sit back, relax, and enjoy Vinay speak about India and Indian authors.

Prof Dharwadker is absolutely amazing! He is the nicest, most caring man and is so knowledgeable about all things India and literature. He also is an overall genius and will randomly have facts about the world woven into his lectures. He is light on homework, and the short stories he assigns are very interesting and relevant to today.

TAKE THIS PROFESSOR, he is so awesome! His lectures were really engaging and he was so passionate about the topic and what he was teaching. The class had 3 quizzes and 2 papers so the work load was perfect. Cannot say anything bad about his class or him as a professor.
The best! Cares about the subject, and it made me care too.

I took "The Modern Short Story" to fulfill my literature requirement, and Dharwadker is a fabulous professor. He brings lots of current events and life lessons into all of his lectures on the stories. It's a great class, and he grades things pretty easily.
Amazing professor. His lectures are very engaging.

Fantastic prof, very intelligent and teaches very well, had great English too. Goes of on pretty extreme tangents sometimes (gave the same lecture twice once) but you'll always learn something if you're engaged.

Vinay was a very resourceful & knowledgeable professor that did a great job at giving us an interdisciplinary approach to literature and made class topics relevant. The class grade is based on 2 essays and a few easy geography quizzes (with extra credit!).  Essay feedback also good. Overall  fun & laidback class. If you need a Lit credit, TAKE HIM!

Took Mod Indian Lit in Translation and this class is pretty interesting and laid back. The work demand for the class is pretty simple and are based off the readings or whatever is covered is class. Don't have to do all the readings, but you'd be lost if you didn't and they do help for the papers. Professor is very knowledgeable and good grader.

Prof. Dharwadker teaches his class in a way that makes reading literature interesting and not tedious. He opens a world to South Asian literature and his selections reflect a wide variety of styles and concepts. One of the nicest people and one of the best classes (and easiest) I've taken. Talk to him and participat and you will do more than well.

This is the easiest class i have ever taken at UW. He babied us like none other. For the first month we just talked about the basics of indian culture and took map quizzes. He was late all the time, and showed us pictures that his daughter took of india. I would have liked to read A LOT MORE than we did but man this class is easy. super nice guy

Vinay is great..he knows a lot about history and current news and ties it in with what we are talking about for the day.  The class is verrry easy. There are a few quizzes at the beginning of the semester on geography and then a few papers due. But you have to do hardly any work for this class, I would definitely recommend it!

He is unorganized and usually shows up late to class. We were like 2 months behind the syllabus and really didn't cover that much material. He kept saying we were going to start to use powerpoints and just have more structure in the class but we never did. With that said, he is very smart and has a ton of cool information. He is really nice and eas

Clear and detailed lectures and he does indeed have a great wealth of knowledge that makes almost every lecture interesting. But he had a hard time getting class participation. Occasionally, it was very hard to appreciate the analysis of the texts when it got overly thorough. But the assignments are clear and the subject interesting. Recommend.

probably one of the easiest graders at this school.  the class is very slow paced, and you dont really have to read anything because he summarizes everything for you in class.  he's full of very interesting facts...take him!!

Modern Indian literature.  I HATE literature classes but Vinay had awesome enthusiasm and made dull material seem interesting.  He is like a Jeopardy contestent with all the strange facts he knows.  He was very helpful during the class and always friendly.
Not as deep as he thinks he is...
